brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to assess the effect of glucagon-like peptide-1 on cardiac output and
      transpulmonary gradient in patients undergoing right heart catheterisation for clinical
      reasons.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) on Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) in Patients With Heart Failure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age over 18

          -  Able to give informed consent

          -  On the waiting list for heart transplant

          -  Left Ventricular Dysfunction awaiting catheterisation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Nicorandil, glibenclamide, Dipeptidyl Peptidase-4 inhibitor, Glucagon-Like Peptide-1
             receptor agonist or insulin

          -  Women of child bearing age and breast feeding women

          -  Cardiac pacemaker or other implanted metallic device

          -  Unable to give informed consent

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) on Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) in Patients With Heart Failure

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulmonary Vascular Resistance with Glucagon-Like Peptide-1

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
